Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\web\AccessRule

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\web\AccessRule » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
This class represents an access rule defined by the yii\web\AccessControl action filter

Hide inherited properties

$denyCallback callback A callback that will be called if this rule determines the access to the current action should be denied yii\web\AccessRule

Protected Methods

MethodDescriptionDefined By
matchAction() yii\web\AccessRule

Property Details

$allow property
boolean $allow = null

Whether this is an 'allow' rule or 'deny' rule.

$actions property
array $actions = null

List of action IDs that this rule applies to. The comparison is case-sensitive. If not set or empty, it means this rule applies to all actions.

$controllers property
array $controllers = null

List of controller IDs that this rule applies to. The comparison is case-sensitive. If not set or empty, it means this rule applies to all controllers.

$roles property
array $roles = null

List of roles that this rule applies to. Two special roles are recognized, and they are checked via yii\web\User::$isGuest: - ?: matches a guest user (not authenticated yet) - @: matches an authenticated user Using additional role names requires RBAC (Role-Based Access Control), and yii\web\User::checkAccess() will be called. If this property is not set or empty, it means this rule applies to all roles.

$ips property
array $ips = null

List of user IP addresses that this rule applies to. An IP address can contain the wildcard * at the end so that it matches IP addresses with the same prefix. For example, '192.168.*' matches all IP addresses in the segment '192.168.'. If not set or empty, it means this rule applies to all IP addresses.

See Also

  • yii\web\Request::$userIP
$verbs property
array $verbs = null

List of request methods (e.g. GET, POST) that this rule applies to. The request methods must be specified in uppercase. If not set or empty, it means this rule applies to all request methods.

See Also

  • yii\web\Request::requestMethod
$matchCallback property
callback $matchCallback = null

A callback that will be called to determine if the rule should be applied. The signature of the callback should be as follows:

function ($rule, $action)

where $rule is this rule, and $action is the current yii\base\Action object. The callback should return a boolean value indicating whether this rule should be applied.

$denyCallback property
callback $denyCallback = null

A callback that will be called if this rule determines the access to the current action should be denied. If not set, the behavior will be determined by yii\web\AccessControl. The signature of the callback should be as follows:

function ($rule, $action)

where $rule is this rule, and $action is the current yii\base\Action object.

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

Method Details

allows() method
boolean|null allows( $action, $user, $request )
$action yii\base\Action The action to be performed
$user yii\web\User The user object
$request yii\web\Request
return boolean|null true if the user is allowed, false if the user is denied, null if the rule does not apply to the user

Checks whether the Web user is allowed to perform the specified action.

matchAction() method
boolean matchAction( $action )
$action yii\base\Action The action
return boolean whether the rule applies to the action

matchController() method
boolean matchController( $controller )
$controller yii\web\Controller The controller
return boolean whether the rule applies to the controller

matchRole() method
boolean matchRole( $user )
$user yii\web\User The user object
return boolean whether the rule applies to the role

matchIP() method
boolean matchIP( $ip )
$ip string The IP address
return boolean whether the rule applies to the IP address

matchVerb() method
boolean matchVerb( $verb )
$verb string The request method
return boolean whether the rule applies to the request

matchCustom() method
boolean matchCustom( $action )
$action yii\base\Action The action to be performed
return boolean whether the rule should be applied
